intro: Pilea nitida, commonly known as the velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves that are slightly hairy to the touch. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by bright orange berries. Pilea nitida is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
